column1: What is Amazon SQS designed for?
column2: Amazon SQS is designed as a message queuing service to enable decoupling of cloud applications.

column1: Which AWS service provides topics for high-throughput, push-based, many-to-many messaging?
How does AWS Step Functions help developers?
column2: AWS Step Functions helps coordinate multiple AWS services into serverless workflows, allowing for quick app building and updates.

column1: What does the Simple Workflow Service (SWF) allow developers to do?
column2: SWF allows developers to build applications that coordinate work across distributed components.

column1: Which AWS service is recommended for new applications, SWF or Step Functions?
column2: Step Functions is recommended for new applications.

column1: What is the primary use of Amazon MQ?
column2: Amazon MQ is used as a managed message broker service for Apache ActiveMQ and RabbitMQ.

column1: Why might one use Amazon MQ over other services?
column2: To migrate on-premises messaging systems to the cloud without changing current applications.

column1: Which AWS service helps in setting up, operating, and sending notifications from the cloud?
How does Amazon SQS ensure data transmission without loss?
column2: SQS can transmit any volume of data, at any level of throughput, without losing messages or requiring other services to be available.

column1: What is the main benefit of using AWS Application Integration Services?
column2: They enable different software applications to work together seamlessly, whether they are on the cloud or on-premises.
